today_in_history_posts.title: OP_BEFOREBLOCKVERIFY - discussing and opcode that invalidates a spend path after a certain block
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- Bitcoin developer BT proposed a new opcode, OP_BEFOREBLOCKVERIFY, for switch-off transactions.
- OP_BBV marks transactions invalid past a certain block height, aiding reversible or expiring payments.
- Despite potential DOS risks and reorg issues, BT seeks community feedback on OP_BBV.

today_in_history_posts.title: Waiting SIGHASH_ANYPREVOUT and Packing Packages
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- Antoine Riard discusses two Lightning network safety issues: pre-signed feerate and transaction pinnings.
- Solutions like package-relay and SIGHASH_ANYPREVOUT are proposed for the pre-signed feerate problem.
- The post suggests package-relay implementation in Bitcoin Core versions 0.24 or 0.25 for LN improvements.

today_in_history_posts.title: Deflationary money is a Good Thing
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- Passive and active investments differ in involvement levels and asset management strategies.
- The blog highlights passive investment issues, including the principal/agent problem and potential economic impacts.
- It suggests central banks could stabilize economies using inflationary currencies backed by deflationary ones like Bitcoin.
